column2: VT DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Vermont
column6: VT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column6: The car approaching from the right.
column8: The car that is traveling faster.
column10: The car approaching from the left.

column2: 2. If you are turning into a street with more than one lane going in your direction, you should:
column4: turn into the lane marked with an arrow.
column6: turn into the closest lane.
column8: turn into the middle lane.

column2: 3. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
4. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: before you enter the crosswalk.
column6: before you enter the intersection.
column8: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 5. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column4: Service signs
column6: Warning signs
column8: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 6. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: look toward the left side of the road.
column6: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column8: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column10: look toward the right side of the road.

column2: 7. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they cannot go straight ahead.
column6: they must stop at the next intersection.
column8: a divided highway is ahead.
column10: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 8. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: finish crossing the street.
column6: stop immediately.
column8: yield to other pedestrians.
column10: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 9. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column6: wait for the next green light.
column8: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column10: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 10. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column8: On slippery roads.

column2: 11. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column6: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 12. Regulatory signs:
column4: provide information about the road rules and traffic laws.
column6: are diamond shaped and yellow or green.
column8: regulate the flow of traffic at school zone.

column2: 13. Parking lights may only be used:
column4: at night.
column6: when visibility is poor.
column8: when your vehicle is parked.

column2: 14. Your vehicles braking distance will be much longer:
column4: on wet, icy or gravel roads.
column6: on interstate highways.
column8: when driving at night.

column2: 15. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: stop
column6: wrong Way
column8: do not enter

column2: 16. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must cross the intersection immdiately.
column6: must always come to a complete stop.
column8: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column10: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.

column2: 17. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 18. Drinking alcoholic beverages:
column4: impairs your judgement.
column6: gives you a feeling of false confidence.
column8: slows your reaction time.

column2: 19. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

column2: 20. Which of the following is true?
column4: Headlights on vehicles must be turned on a half hour after sunset to a half hour before sunset.
column6: Drivers must turn their headlights on when snow, rain and fog make it hard to see.
column8: Driving with low beams on during the daytime reduces the risk of head-on collisions.
